That is most likely the problem. So our application will be running as part of the eclipse IDE. Our requirement is that we will have reports that live outside the IDE workspace and project structure, and so we need to be able to load, these reports into the report designer. If I understand correctly, in this case, I can't replace the IDE plugin with the RCP plugin because we are in the IDE. Can we get an IDE API that allows the loading of reports from outside the workspace? Any other workarounds you all can suggest?

As i tested, the BIRT RCP plugin can work under eclipe ide enviroment. Do you need specail feature of BIRT IDE plug-in. The main different is BIRT RCP editor don't support eclipe navigator ,workspace and project concept. All file are accessed directly from file system. The BIRT IDE editor support eclipe navigator and alos the workspace and project concept. 
Can you use RCP editor only? The main feature of BIRT are there with BIRT RCP plugin.
What you need to do is remove org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide plug-in from plugins directory and install org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp plug-in in plugins directory.

Another work around can be write your own editor by extends from ReportEditor. You need write your own implmementation of interface IReportEditorInput to handle the case of opening external files.
Please refer to RCP plugin codes. It's quite easy to do that because there're only a few codes in RCP editor and ReportEditoInput classes.
